page.title: 12FELTWELL'S CHARITABLE TRUSTS
page.content: Feltwell is lucky to have three trusts. The most important is the Sir Edmund de Moundeford Trust. The other trusts are Acmere and Rawlings. Sir Edmund de Moundeford left 660 acres of poor fenland to the parish for grazing and peat cutting. Now it is rich farmland rented by local farmers. Edmund de Moundeford Trust gives the people over seventy, twelve pounds at Christmas. Almshouse residents live rent free, get 75p a week free T.V licence, free electricity and a certain amount of fireing each year. The children get twenty five pounds on leaving Feltwell School for Methwold High School. In the last five years the trust has given Feltwell School a swimming pool and has bought a strip of playing field which the council wanted to sell for building.
